title: Combat Component
description: Add 3rd person combat to any asset in less than a minute
longDescription:
The purpose of this asset is to allow for quick combat prototyping for any 3rd person project by adding a component and performing the least amount of tweaks to existing logic. I love fluid, realistic movement mechanics from assets like the Advanced Locomotion System & Epic's Game Animation Sample project; however, there's nothing you can really do with them unless you pour hundreds of hours integrating other complicated assets, or building out logic that ends up being hard-coded to the project itself.


⚠️ BUYER PLEASE READ⚠️

This is a BLUEPRINT focused asset, which means this asset's primary goal is to implement game logic. Although I strive to make animations the best I can, they are not perfect. They are merely placeholder animations meant to be replaced with higher-quality ones that match weapons you'd use.


✅ CONFIRMED & DOCUMENTED INTEGRATIONS ✅

  • Advanced Locomotion System
  • Game Animation Sample
  • AI Behavior Toolkit

technicalDetails:
🌠 Features

  • Melee & Ranged weapons (2-hand sword, sword & shield, pistol, rifle, fists, grenade)
  • Combo system for melee
  • Shoot & alt attack (melee) for ranged
  • Aim & strafe locomotion, dashing
  • Integration-ready
  • Basic UI, Inventory, Weapon Shortcuts (easy to disable with bools from component)


📘 Number of Blueprints: 3 Essentials, 72 total

99% of what you'll use is in these blueprints below. The rest are children, widgets, etc. that you may or may not use

  1. Combat Component
  2. ABP_CombatComponent
  3. BP_Weapon (& children)


🎮 Input: Mouse & Keyboard, Xbox Controller (Missing a few inputs from mouse & keyboard)

🌍 Network Replicated: No (but will look into in future updates, shouldn't be too hard to add)

Supported Development Platforms:

Windows: Yes

Mac: Yes

DOCUMENTATION

Important/Additional Notes: This isn't necessarily that complex of an asset as my steps are very simple & straightforward; however, the actual blueprints themselves may be complicated for complete beginners
